The Elder Sampasādaka
“I pay homage to you, O Buddha, O hero,
you are liberated in every way;
I have fallen into misfortune,
be my refuge.”
Siddhattha explained to him,
the one who has no equal in the world:
“The Saṅgha is like the great ocean,
incalculable, unsurpassed.
In that field free from dust,
which gives infinite fruits,
having confidence in the Saṅgha,
plant the seed of a good rebirth.”
Having said this, the all-knowing one,
the world’s chief, the bull among men,
having instructed me,
rose up into the sky.
Not long after the all-knowing one,
the bull among men, had left,
I died and was reborn in Tusita,
in the celestial world.
Then in that field free from dust,
which gives infinite fruits,
having confidence in the Saṅgha,
I rejoiced in heaven for an eon.
For ninety-four eons
I attained confidence then;
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of confidence.
